[M2] (golly 4.1b1)
#N State-lookup clock gun
#C By placing blocks on the path of a clock gun, between semi-Snarks,
#C we can have it fire its first glider at many different times.
#C In the configuration shown here, if there are "a" blocks on the SW
#C side, "b" blocks on the NW side, "c" blocks on the NE side,
#C and "d" blocks on the SE side, the first glider will be
#C generated by the Herschel that is present at generation
#C 1024*(a + 8*b + 64*c + 512*d). That first escaping glider is used
#C to pluck out the (a + 8*b + 64*c + 512*d)-th chunk from the
#C single-channel glider stream coming from the northwest.
#R B3/S23
$$$$$$......*$.......*$
4 0 0 0 1
5 0 0 0 2
6 0 0 0 3
7 0 0 0 4
8 0 0 0 5
